script: I was absolutely shocked when we finally walked into the main museum exhibit on Tuesday. Honestly, I really didn't expect the place to be that incredibly busy on a random weekday afternoon. There were literally hundreds of tourists lining up outside just waiting for an audio guide to become available. I mean, who goes to an ancient history museum right in the middle of a beautiful beach day? It completely threw off our entire sightseeing itinerary for the afternoon.

options: To explicitly emphasize genuine shock and disbelief at an unexpected travel situation.
To aggressively complain to the tour guide about the long wait time.
To confidently boast about predicting exactly how crowded the venue would be.
To politely ask the museum guard what time the exhibit usually closes.
question.prompt: Why does the speaker start their sentence with the adverb 'Honestly'?

explanation: The speaker uses 'Honestly' as an emphatic pragmatical marker to underscore the sincerity of their complete surprise while traveling.
